remarks: A finite sum in an ordered monoid is monotonic.  This proof would be much easier in an ordered group, where an inverse element would be available.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 13-Mar-2018.)
statement:
gsumle.b $e |- B = ( Base ` M ) $.
gsumle.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` M ) $.
gsumle.m $e |- ( ph -> M e. oMnd ) $.
gsumle.n $e |- ( ph -> M e. CMnd ) $.
gsumle.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. Fin ) $.
gsumle.f $e |- ( ph -> F : A --> B ) $.
gsumle.g $e |- ( ph -> G : A --> B ) $.
gsumle.c $e |- ( ph -> F oR .<_ G ) $.
gsumle $p |- ( ph -> ( M gsum F ) .<_ ( M gsum G ) ) $.
